clean_text: On October 15, 2023, a fictional financial institution 'SecureBank Corp.' reported anomalous activity. ShadowNet, a simulated advanced persistent threat group, initiated reconnaissance by browsing to a CDN lookup service to gather intelligence on SecureBank's content delivery network. Concurrently, the actor staged capabilities by uploading a malicious PowerShell script to a private GitHub repository for later deployment. In the initial access phase, phishing messages posing as Microsoft Teams notifications were sent to compromise corporate social media account credentials, while malware was configured to automatically connect to any open Wi-Fi access point named 'Free_WiFi' to facilitate network infiltration. Upon execution, PoetRAT was deployed using spearphishing attachments to infect victims, and persistence was established by dropping a suspicious DLL named 'printmon.dll' into the spool drivers directory to act as a port monitor. During discovery, the adversary employed SVCReady to collect time zone information and performed Active Directory enumeration of victim environments to assess domain trust. For command and control, multi-stage channels were utilized, with the threat actor running 'host_info.ps1' to gather detailed system configuration data for C2 optimization. Finally, for impact, BlackCat was used to change the desktop wallpaper on compromised hosts as part of an internal defacement strategy. System logs from SecureBank showed routine database backups at 2:00 AM EST, unrelated to the attack. The company, founded in 1995, specializes in digital banking services across North America.
tagged_text: On October 15, 2023, a fictional financial institution 'SecureBank Corp.' reported anomalous activity. ShadowNet, a simulated advanced persistent threat group, initiated reconnaissance by browsing to a CDN lookup service to gather intelligence on SecureBank's content delivery network [T1596.004]. Concurrently, the actor staged capabilities by uploading a malicious PowerShell script to a private GitHub repository for later deployment [T1608]. In the initial access phase, phishing messages posing as Microsoft Teams notifications were sent to compromise corporate social media account credentials [T1586.001], while malware was configured to automatically connect to any open Wi-Fi access point named 'Free_WiFi' to facilitate network infiltration [T1669]. Upon execution, PoetRAT was deployed using spearphishing attachments to infect victims [T1204.002], and persistence was established by dropping a suspicious DLL named 'printmon.dll' into the spool drivers directory to act as a port monitor [T1547.010]. During discovery, the adversary employed SVCReady to collect time zone information [T1124] and performed Active Directory enumeration of victim environments to assess domain trust [T1482]. For command and control, multi-stage channels were utilized, with the threat actor running 'host_info.ps1' to gather detailed system configuration data for C2 optimization [T1104]. Finally, for impact, BlackCat was used to change the desktop wallpaper on compromised hosts as part of an internal defacement strategy [T1491.001]. System logs from SecureBank showed routine database backups at 2:00 AM EST, unrelated to the attack. The company, founded in 1995, specializes in digital banking services across North America.

llm_raw_response.title: Joint Cybersecurity Advisory: Fictional APT Campaign 'ShadowNet' Targeting Financial Sector
llm_raw_response.summary: This advisory details a simulated campaign by the fictional threat actor group 'ShadowNet' targeting financial institutions. The campaign involves reconnaissance via CDNs, credential phishing, and multi-stage malware deployment for data exfiltration and internal disruption. Blue teams should use this report for training to identify and mitigate similar tactics.
llm_raw_response.full_report_text: On October 15, 2023, a fictional financial institution 'SecureBank Corp.' reported anomalous activity. ShadowNet, a simulated advanced persistent threat group, initiated reconnaissance by browsing to a CDN lookup service to gather intelligence on SecureBank's content delivery network [T1596.004]. Concurrently, the actor staged capabilities by uploading a malicious PowerShell script to a private GitHub repository for later deployment [T1608]. In the initial access phase, phishing messages posing as Microsoft Teams notifications were sent to compromise corporate social media account credentials [T1586.001], while malware was configured to automatically connect to any open Wi-Fi access point named 'Free_WiFi' to facilitate network infiltration [T1669]. Upon execution, PoetRAT was deployed using spearphishing attachments to infect victims [T1204.002], and persistence was established by dropping a suspicious DLL named 'printmon.dll' into the spool drivers directory to act as a port monitor [T1547.010]. During discovery, the adversary employed SVCReady to collect time zone information [T1124] and performed Active Directory enumeration of victim environments to assess domain trust [T1482]. For command and control, multi-stage channels were utilized, with the threat actor running 'host_info.ps1' to gather detailed system configuration data for C2 optimization [T1104]. Finally, for impact, BlackCat was used to change the desktop wallpaper on compromised hosts as part of an internal defacement strategy [T1491.001]. System logs from SecureBank showed routine database backups at 2:00 AM EST, unrelated to the attack. The company, founded in 1995, specializes in digital banking services across North America.
